content: The Great Barrier Reef, the world's largest coral reef system, can be found off the coast of which continent?

The Great Barrier Reef, the world's largest coral reef system, can be found off the coast of the continent of Australia. It is located in the Coral Sea, off the coast of the Queensland, Australia. The reef is composed of over 2,900 individual reefs and 900 islands stretching for over 2,300 kilometers (1,400 miles). It is home to a diverse range of marine life and is considered one of the Seven Natural Wonders of the World. The Great Barrier Reef is also a World Heritage Site and is protected by the Great Barrier Reef Marine Park.
